Race.SpecificTitle: Council Member(s) -- City of Denham Springs
PW HRC Prop. No. 1 -- PC - Amd. Art. II Sec. 2-13A
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No.1
Race.FullText: Shall Article II, Section 2-13, subparagraph A of the Home Rule Charter of the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana be amended to provide that any ordinance adopted by the Council be presented to the Parish President by the Council Clerk within seven (7) days after adoption, excluding Saturdays, Sundays and holidays?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Prop. No. 2 -- PC - Amd. Art. III Sec. 3-09 (A) (5)
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions 
Propostion No. 2
Race.FullText: Shall Article III, Section 3-09, subparagraph (A)(5) of the Home Rule Charter of the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana be amended to clarify the authority of the Parish President to enter into certain contracts and to otherwise enable the Parish President to read "Sign contracts for projects, equipment, professional services and materials and supplies specifically identified in the approved operating and capital improvement budgets or as specifically identified by ordinance. Contracts for projects, equipment, professional services or materials and supplies not specifically identified in the approved operating and capital improvement budgets or specifically identified by ordinance shall be submitted to the Council for approval prior to signature of the Parish President."?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Prop. No. 3 -- PC - Amd. Art. IV Sec. 4-02 (B)
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions 
Proposition No. 3
Race.FullText: Shall Article IV, Section 4-02, subsection (B) of the Home Rule Charter of the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana be amended to allow the Council to retain special attorneys to represent the Parish subject to the restrictions imposed by the laws and statutes of the State of Louisiana and further allow the governing authority to create a separate full-time or part-time Parish attorney's office on a temporary or permanent basis in lieu or in addition to the District Attorney and create such a position or department and provides for its organization in accordance with the general provisions of the Charter?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Prop. No. 4 -- PC - Amd. Art. IV Sec. 4-03 (A)
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions 
Proposition No. 4
Race.FullText: Shall Article IV, Section 4-03, subsection (A) of the Home Rule Charter of the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana be amended to amend the job requirements for the Director of Finance and, in particular, to require experience in a governmental accounting position to read as follows: "The Director of Finance, at the time of appointment, shall have a bachelor's degree in accounting from an accredited college or university, and at least two (2) years' experience in a responsible governmental accounting position or a bachelor's degree in business administration or a related field from an accredited college or university, and at least three (3) years' experience in a responsible governmental accounting position or an associate's degree in accounting from a community college and at least five (5) years' experience in a governmental accounting position."?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Prop. No. 5 -- PC - Amd. Art. V Sec. 5-02 (B)
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions 
Proposition No. 5
Race.FullText: Shall Article V, Section 5-02, subsection (B) of the Home Rule Charter of the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana be amended to provide that "upon the failure of the Parish Council to adopt a budget by the end of the current fiscal year, the budget for the previous fiscal year shall continue in effect for no more than six (6) months into the next fiscal year and expenditures shall be limited to no more than 50% of the amount appropriated for the prior fiscal year."?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection District No. 10 -- 11.1 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 10 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 10 of the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of eleven and one tenth mills (11.1) on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $172,050 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2024, for the purpose of purchasing fire trucks and other fire fighting equipment, and for acquiring and constructing buildings to be used to house fire fighting equipment, and for acquiring, maintaining, operating and developing the District's fire protection facilities and equipment (including first response emergency vehicle services)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation Dist. No. 2 -- 15 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall Recreation District No. 2 of Livingston Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), renew the levy and collection of a tax of fifteen (15) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $849,862.00 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) (the "Tax"), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2024, for the purpose of constructing, improving, maintaining and operating the recreational facilities governed by the District?
